result.execSummary:
The defendant David D. Oldenburg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--Court sentences the Defendant to pay costs of $443; due in $30 incriments per month, beginning 8/21/16 and on the 21st day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 8 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

--Court orders Mr. Oldenburg to report to JESO today following today's hearing to submit a DNA Sample

--0 days credit for time served

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:22 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant David D. Oldenburg in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Court sentences the Defendant to pay costs of $443; due in $30 incriments per month, beginning 8/21/16 and on the 21st day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 8 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
Court orders Mr. Oldenburg to report to JESO today following today's hearing to submit a DNA Sample
0 days credit for time served
Recess: 10:32 am
Status conference on June 21, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2016 at 11:20 am.

Case called at 2:39pm 
Defendant David D. Oldenburg in court with attorney Whitney Hagemann.  DA Susan Happ  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

recess: 2:42pm


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/27/16 at 11:20am    (2)  Status Conference on 6/21/16 at 9:30am
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant is eligible.

Case called at 2:25 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for adjourned initial appearance)
Defendant David D. Oldenburg in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Oldenburg submits SPD Determination of eligibility that notes Mr. Oldenburg is eligible for representation, but no one could appear today

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived. DOB & address confirmed accurate
Court reviews SPD determination and informs parties that It will reset adjourned initial
Court continues bond as previously set
Recess: 2:29 pm

NEXT: (1) Reschedule Adjourned Initial Appearance 3/22/16 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 3:17ppm [mo]
Defendant David D. Oldenburg in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Oldenburg. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Mr. Oldenburg verifies that he was present when the Court gave the right to counsel and constructive waiver of counsel warnings to another Defendant
--Mr. Oldenburg indicates that he wishes to obtain counsel

The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 

The Court requires $750  signature bond, with conditions: 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
--Mr. Oldenburg is to contact the Jefferson SPD office by 12/7/15 at 4:00pm to schedule an appointment for eligibility determination 
recess: 3:22pm


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 2/2/16 at 2:00pm
